poem:
### Powerlines of Strife

In Zaporizhzhia's cold  
shadow, wires severed—  
an iron silence hums.  
Power lines, lifelines,  
tensed threads of fate.  
No shells' whistle,  
only whispers of intent,  
crackling through scorched  
patience, as atom's  
cool breath falters.  
A dim world waits—  
held by the trembling  
current of war's hand.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia accused of sabotaging last power line into Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant Russia has been accused of deliberately sabotaging the last remaining power line into the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, after satellite imagery of the damaged area showed no sign of Ukrainian shelling that Moscow says is preventing a repair. Outside power, normally used for cooling, has now been down for a record eight days, forcing the Russian operators of the plant in occupied Ukraine to rely". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
